title: Nobody is missing the point of reworks
body:
Everyone knows some champs get reworked because they suffer from inherent unhealthy desgins. But the problem is those issue almost never gets solved and most of the times the reworks tend to aggravate the issue rather than making the champs more healthy gamewise

I will just say it the following champs I had less issues with them prerework: 
{{champion:122}} Who tought giving him a heal on his Q + reset on his ult woudl be a good idea?
{{champion:7}} Still oneshots people without counterplay but now also got a good waveclear
{{champion:8}} Still the toxic non-interactive champ in lane who needs to be kept in trashtier otherwise he will dominate LCS
{{champion:13}} Maybe the 10th rework will hit the mark
{{champion:90}} Received 2 minireworks after the rework nobody ever asked for. Do I need to say more
{{champion:41}}  Still tries to passively farm the lane and outscale and generating free gold and 'ganking' botlane by pressing the skillbutton. 
{{champion:114}} Same problem Tryndamere has. Lane is decided on RNG. Generally unfun to play against when she is strong in meta because when she is strong she is instantly OP.
{{champion:104}} Already reveived countless nerfs but is still a top pick in the jungle crowding out slower tank junglers. The guy has it all. Mobility, burst, sustained damaged, tankiness, ranged. Talking about generic kits.
{{champion:86}} Useless champ
{{champion:107}} Still oneshots people but now with tank items
{{champion:72}} Nobody likes the spires.
{{champion:35}} Is this really a healthier design?
{{champion:134}} First she needed sphere management now she just presses R
{{champion:143}} Condemed to be a support but when she is strong in botlane she is not fun to play against. Just try laning vs Zyra+Cait 
{{champion:154}} Changes for the sake of changes. He was already a unique champ with a stable pick/win rate. Now he is lackluster. Especially his ult
{{champion:44}} Useless champ. Everything he does another support can do better. He doesn't have anything that makes you want to pick him in certain situations.
{{champion:161}} Changes for the sake of changes nobody asked for. 
{{champion:82}} He is the posterchild of failed reworks.
{{champion:133}} Needs to be kept trashtier oterwise she will make toplane living hell for melee champs.

Two of the reworks did turn out good {{champion:14}} {{champion:78}}. But only tow of them thus the success rate is embarrassingly low. The others need another rework or smaller scope changes but the fact is a very large mayority of the reworks are NOT improving the champions. The question now is not when will they receive another rework but when will Riot hire competent game designers?

Sion, Poppy, Yorick, and Galio's "reworks" were all, by definition, complete failures.

A rework's purpose is to modernize their kits. The changes made to them didn't modernize them in any way, shape, or form. They're all completely different abilities, and the champion's old identity has been lost, not to mention the visuals are completely different and voiceovers, too.

Now quickly tell me what was Old Sion's identity? Other than being a bit of everything but good in nothing?

Old Poppy? Other than being the champion with easily the most unhealthy ultimate in the entire game?

Old Galio? Other than being Rammus' equivalent against full AP comps?

Old Yorick? Other than being more uninteractive than Kayle ever was and not transmitting the feel of an actual gravedigger from the Shadow Isles.

Their reworks weren´t failures by any means. It modernized their kits according to the ever changing design preferences of Riot. It made them more healthy, and gave them actual personality, lore-wise.

The champions' old identity wasn´t lost, because they had no identity to lose in the first place.

After all, the old lore was retconned. And the new one, minus a few exceptions(Targon and Elise) is considerably better.

> Now quickly tell me what was Old Sion's identity? Other than being a bit of everything but good in nothing?

Arnold Schwarzenegger.  

That was pretty much it.

"Bit of everything but good in nothing". You mean slowly lumbering into the enemy team 1v3 and coming out with full health? Is being an unkillable lifesteal zombie not enough of an identity for you?

Poppy was a small, yet determined diver who could jump in 1v5 and still manage to kill her target before going down. Her voice reflected that pretty well, too, as well as her lore.

??? What do you mean "Rammus' equivalent against full AP comps?"? I honestly have no idea what you mean by this. What did Galio actually do vs AP Champions? Stack MR and end up hitting everyone like a soaked noodle? And no, this isn't a problem with the champion, this is a problem with YOU. If you don't know how to properly use a champion, it doesn't mean the champion is bad, or outdated, or anything, it means that YOU are the problem. Galio had the least wrong with him out of any of these poor champions that were removed. Anyways, Galio's identity was THE teamfight tank/mage hybrid. His ult was incredibly rewarding if you pulled it off right, and no, you didn't need to flash ult them. You could just ult. Flash helped his ultimate, yeah, but doesn't using flash help EVERYTHING?

Yorick was a hyperscaling juggernaut, and unlike Nasus, his kit was based around summoning minions to fight alongside him in battle. Also, he could come back from death, which, for a zombie, makes perfect sense. Just because he was "The Gravedigger" doesn't mean he has to literally dig a fucking grave. How the hell would that work, anyway?

Also, Targon is great. Targon used to be some vague ass place no one knew about, and now we know a lot more, and it's overall just a lot more interesting. Also, no, the "old lore" was never retconned. Riot never decided that they were going to completely get rid of every single champion's lore. The only thing that was retconned was the IOW, and the champions' lores who were connected to it.

No he wasn't and you're goddamn blind with nostalgia if you thought Yorick was anything good after the laning phase.  He scaled HORRIBLY and he fits his thematic of a necromantic summoner better than he did before.

How was that unhealthy gameplay? That's what a fucking juggernaut is. Hard to kill, immobile, and deals a lot of sustained damage. If you want to say the idea of Juggernauts in general is unhealthy, then fine, you win, because I don't really know what to say to that.

Poppy? Unhealthy? The only reason people complained is because people were using her ult in ways that weren't intended, and there was an easy fix to that. They could have made it so that she could ONLY deal damage to the person they targeted, so that way, you would ACTUALLY have to go for that person. That way, she would be a diver who did exactly what a diver is supposed to do. Single out a target and kill them. Actually, that's also what assassins are supposed to do, except even quicker than fighters. Unlike assassins, however, divers tend to get out alive even less, unless they played really well or were ahead. So, unless you want to say that divers are unhealthy in general, no, Poppy didn't deserve to be turned into a mentally retarded support for her ADC.

Um, how was he an AP Rammus if you weren't supposed to be stacking MR on him in the first place? That makes no sense. Also, I'm sorry, but isn't the role of a tank to like, get in and soak damage? That's what his W did amazingly well, as well as his ult. Also, getting in close helped you land your Q and E, which both chunked the crap out of people, and ulting helped you land your Q and E even better. I don't know why the hell you find Galio's kit odd. Up until they decided to "rework" him, I had almost never heard anyone complaining about Galio's kit. All I heard were people saying he was hardly played, or needed to be played more.

I'm not blind with nostalgia, lol. Yorick's laning phase was fucking trash. His cooldowns were high. He had mana issues. He had problems sticking to people. He was squishier because of his high cooldowns. He healed less because of his high cooldowns. He moved slower because of his high cooldowns. He blocked less skillshots because of his high cooldowns. His cooldowns were simply too high, and he absolutely needed items to function. Also, his base damages were fucking shit, and his ghouls were slow, too. All you have to fucking do to see that you're wrong is actually WATCH a game of Old Yorick. You won't see someone dominating their lane with him like you do now, I guarantee it. The only reason you're saying this is because you either sucked with Yorick and/or didn't know how to play him, or didn't even bother playing him in the first place, and you formed your opinion solely based on what everyone else has said about him. There's a good word for that. It's called being a sheep.

Lol. Yorick's playrate? Yorick's kit health? Do you know how fucking oppressive Yorick is in the laning phase now, and how useless he is outside of it? They tied his ghoul strength to last hitting minions, and since you don't get the opportunity to hit minions outside of lane, and don't get the opportunity to kill minions in teamfights, he's VERY weak in them.

Poppy had problems, I'll admit. Some pretty big problems. She'd slam into you and brutalize you, and it felt pretty unfair, I guess, but she still slams into you now and it feels unfair. What's even worse is that you can't even fucking dash away anymore, and if you don't have a dash, then her W is 100% useless. Do you know how fucking binary that is? They could have easily fixed her ultimate without having to completely change every ability except for one.

Galio's kit was fine. There was pretty much nothing wrong with it. He had the same level of counterplay he does now, maybe even more. To be honest, I don't have much of a problem with this- Not as much as with Poppy and especially Yorick. They removed a perfectly fine champion and replaced him with a perfectly fine champion. I'd probably play the new Galio a lot regularly if he didn't take up the slot of old Galio.

Sion... Yeah. His playrate was almost nonexistant. I only saw him like, three times out of 1000 games. He had the option of going either AD or AP, and both were perfectly viable, but that's because two of his abilities were incredibly strong with AP, and two of his abilities were incredibly strong with AD, which was... Really strange. It's clear he was meant to be played AD, though, because he wielded a big fucking axe, and his lore made a lot more sense with his AD playstyle. What they did to him made no sense, though. Instead of reinforcing his intended playstle, they just scrapped everything about him completely. No AD, no AP, just some dumb CC Tank. It's funny, how his name used to be "The Undead Champion", and he functioned much more as a Juggernaut, but when they changed his name to "The Undead JUGGERNAUT", he became less of a Juggernaut. Hah. Oh well, I guess.

You and her both have control over the vitals appearing, but not where they´ll appear, despite the fact it´s pretty clear how the pseudo-RNG works. It´s just a matter of not trading when she has a vital in her favor.

He's far more interactive than before. Blood Rush makes it obvious when he's strong and he's rather weak without it. His E can now be body blocked, by minions no less, reducing the free poke he gets on you just cuz he's AOE'ing the minion wave or something like that.

The reason he dominates in LCS is because of the damage amp on his ultimate, something coordinated teams can abuse a thousand times more than the average yolo q of 5 while also being a safe laner. The damage amp was in fact stronger before the rework, and the safety issue was handled by making Spirit Visage less effective for making Vlad a 1 item wonder.
